scenarioDescription:
The K2-233 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-233 is a star with 0.8 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.74 times its radius. It is located 220.18 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 0.36 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

K2-233 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-233 system


K2-233 b

K2-233 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-233 b is 2.538 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-233 b is 1.398 that of Earth. At 2.538 Earth masses, K2-233 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


K2-233 c

K2-233 c was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.07 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-233 c is 2.347 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-233 c is 1.335 that of Earth. At 2.347 Earth masses, K2-233 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.


K2-233 d

K2-233 d was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2018-05, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-233 d is 7.473 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-233 d is 2.640 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-233 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system K2-233, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-233 - System With 3 Exolanets
